alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Hamilton; Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 10:44AM EST until January 14 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Hamilton County in eastern New York... Northwestern Fulton County in eastern New York... Southern Herkimer County in eastern New York... * Until 1130 AM EST. * At 1043 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of McKeever to East Freetown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 30. Locations impacted include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Speculator, Mohawk, Frankfort, Dolgeville, Ohio, West Winfield, Lake Pleasant, Newport, Stratford, Middleville, Poland, Cold Brook, Jordanville, Moffitt Beach Campground, Northwood, Cedarville, and Russia. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
